import numpy as np
# (Number of 'x' marks in the first row)
# Usefulness: This feature directly measures the presence of player 'x' marks in a crucial part of the board, indicating progress towards one of the 8 winning lines. It can help the classifier identify boards where 'x' is close to or has already achieved a win in the top row.
# Input samples: 'top-left-square': [np.int64(2), np.int64(0), np.int64(1)], 'top-middle-square': [np.int64(1), np.int64(1), np.int64(2)], 'top-right-square': [np.int64(0), np.int64(1), np.int64(2)]
df['x_count_top_row'] = ((df['top-left-square'] == 0).astype(int) +
                         (df['top-middle-square'] == 0).astype(int) +
                         (df['top-right-square'] == 0).astype(int))

# (Number of 'x' marks in the middle row)
# Usefulness: Similar to the top row, this feature identifies patterns of 'x' in the middle horizontal line, which is a potential winning line for player 'x'. It helps the model detect partial or complete wins along this specific row.
# Input samples: 'middle-left-square': [np.int64(1), np.int64(0), np.int64(1)], 'middle-middle-square': [np.int64(1), np.int64(2), np.int64(2)], 'middle-right-square': [np.int64(2), np.int64(1), np.int64(2)]
df['x_count_middle_row'] = ((df['middle-left-square'] == 0).astype(int) +
                            (df['middle-middle-square'] == 0).astype(int) +
                            (df['middle-right-square'] == 0).astype(int))
